headline: UnitedHealth replaces CFO Rex in another management shake-up
summary: Rex, who has been the company's CFO since 2016, will continue as a strategic adviser to the CEO, with the changes effective September 2.  DeVeydt, 55, was most recently managing director and operating partner at Bain Capital, and was also the finance chief of UnitedHealth's rival Elevance, then called Anthem, between 2007 and 2016.  DeVeydt will get an annual base salary of $1 million and other benefits such as equity awards and a $2 million life insurance policy, UnitedHealth said.

DeVeydt will get an annual base salary of $1 million and other benefits such as equity awards and a $2 million life insurance policy, UnitedHealth said.

headline: Cigna Group (CI) Reports Q2 Revenue Surge To US$67,178 Million, Net Income Flat
summary: Cigna Group (CI) reported their Q2 and H1 2025 earnings, highlighting significant growth in both sales and revenue year-over-year, although Q2 net income saw a slight dip. Over the past week, Cigna's stock experienced a 2% decline, possibly impacted by the mixed earnings results. Despite strong earnings from other companies like Microsoft and Meta boosting the tech-heavy indices, Cigna's performance diverged from the broader market's flat trend. The market's general resilience, supported by...

summary: CI's Q2 earnings benefit from strong Evernorth Health Services unit, offsetting customer losses and rising costs. It continues to expect 2025 adjusted EPS at a minimum of $29.60.

headline: Cigna Group shares rise as Q2 results top estimates
summary: Investing.com -- The Cigna (NYSE:CI) Group reported better-than-expected second quarter 2025 results on Wednesday, as strong growth in its Evernorth Health Services segment drove revenue significantly higher. Shares rose 1% following the announcement.

headline: Cigna (NYSE:CI) Reports Strong Q2
summary: Health insurance company Cigna (NYSE:CI) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 11.1% year on year to $67.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $7.20 per share was 0.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Cigna: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: BLOOMFIELD, Conn. AP) — The Cigna Group (CI) on Thursday reported second-quarter earnings of $1.53 billion. On a per-share basis, the Bloomfield, Connecticut-based company said it had profit of $5.71.

headline: Cigna beats profit estimate on robust health services growth
summary: It is one of the last health insurers to report quarterly results for the sector, which has been bogged down by persistently high medical costs in government-backed plans.  Cigna, however, is insulated from such cost pressures as it recently sold its Medicare business to Health Care Service Corp. It banks more on its pharmacy benefit management and commercial health insurance businesses.
